title: Czechs look for respite as heatwave hits Prague
description:
(1 Aug 2017) Locals and tourists in the city of Prague tried to stay cool as temperatures reached 38 degrees celsius (100.4 Fahrenheit) on Tuesday, making it the hottest day this summer. 
The searing heat didn't stop everyone from venturing outdoors - many took to the Vltava river on paddle boats to enjoy the sun.
The Czech Meteorological Institute has warned the heatwave was nowhere near the end and the hot weather could continue for several more days.
